docs.snippet: Jason Kander, an ex-military officer, released a TV ad in which he assembled an AR-15 blindfolded. Suddenly, his race against Senator Roy D. Blunt was close....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jason Kander, an ex-military officer, released a TV ad in which he assembled an AR-15 blindfolded. Suddenly, his race against Senator Roy D. Blunt was close.
docs.abstract: Jason Kander, Democrat challenging Republican Roy Blunt for his United States Senate seat in Missouri.Democratic candidate for Missouri's Senate, surges ahead in polls after posting internet video of himself assembling AR-!5 assault rifle while blindfolded and reciting poem about gun rights; Kander's dramatic ascent illustrates volatile and shifting dynamics at play in battle for Senate.

headline.main: A Democrat Deft With a Firearm Tightens the Race for the Senate
headline.print_headline: Democrat, Deft With Rifle, Tightens Senate Race

byline.contributor: Rachel Shorey contributed reporting from Washington.

docs.snippet: U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump promised on Saturday to foil a proposed deal for AT&T to buy Time Warner if he wins the Nov. 8 election, arguing it was an example of a "power structure" rigged against both him and voters....

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: How should America use its influence in a world where being a superpower doesn't get you what it once did? As instability and human tragedy in Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya and Syria have shown, the U.S. alone cannot impose solutions or forc...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: How should America use its influence in a world where being a superpower doesn't get you what it once did? As instability and human tragedy in Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya and Syria have shown, the U.S. alone cannot impose solutions or force the surrender of adversaries like the Islamic State group, which cannot be deterred by the threat of nuclear attack.

headline.main: WHY IT MATTERS: America and the World
headline.print_headline: WHY IT MATTERS: America and the World

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: There are an estimated 21.6 million veterans in the United States. Among them, nearly 9 million are enrolled in health care provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs. About 4.3 million veterans get disability compensation from the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: There are an estimated 21.6 million veterans in the United States. Among them, nearly 9 million are enrolled in health care provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs. About 4.3 million veterans get disability compensation from the VA and nearly 900,000 have been diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.

docs.snippet: The clamor for change fueling Republican Donald Trump's presidential campaign may help a little-known Democrat upset a powerful GOP senator in red-state Missouri on Election Day. And with just a handful of competitive races around the country, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The clamor for change fueling Republican Donald Trump's presidential campaign may help a little-known Democrat upset a powerful GOP senator in red-state Missouri on Election Day. And with just a handful of competitive races around the country, the outcome in Missouri could help determine control of the Senate.

headline.main: Race in GOP-Friendly Missouri Could Determine Senate Control
headline.print_headline: Race in GOP-Friendly Missouri Could Determine Senate Control

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: No one likes an even number on a court that makes decisions by majority vote. Yet that's just what the Supreme Court has been left with, eight justices, since the death of Antonin Scalia in February....
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: No one likes an even number on a court that makes decisions by majority vote. Yet that's just what the Supreme Court has been left with, eight justices, since the death of Antonin Scalia in February.

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: The right to bear arms is fundamental to the U.S., carved into the Constitution and seemingly embedded in the national DNA. But after a seemingly endless stretch of violence, Americans are confronting how far those rights extend, propel...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: The right to bear arms is fundamental to the U.S., carved into the Constitution and seemingly embedded in the national DNA. But after a seemingly endless stretch of violence, Americans are confronting how far those rights extend, propelling gun issues to the forefront of this year's elections.
